meanings.definition: A unit of currency in Latvia, equal to one hundredth of a lat.
meanings.sent1: In Latvia, you can buy small things with just a few santims.
meanings.sent2: I exchanged my euros for santims at the bank.
meanings.sent3: The vending machine only accepts santims, so I had to search for some.
meanings.sent4: Her love for shopping was like a river flowing with santims.
meanings.sent5: The sound of santims jingling in his pocket was music to his ears.

meanings.definition: Plural form of santim, referring to multiple units of currency in Latvia.
meanings.sent1: She counted her santims carefully before paying for the souvenir.
meanings.sent2: The shopkeeper handed me a handful of santims as change.
meanings.sent3: The kids pretended to be rich, throwing around their toy santims.
meanings.sent4: The room was filled with the clinking of santims as people made purchases.
meanings.sent5: The market was bustling with vendors shouting prices in santims.
